page.title: 03HOUSING DEIGHTON
page.content: Deighton village remains small, consisting of the church,village hall and a row of cottages built of local brick,several of which are single storey, and surrounded by farms. The main change is that most of the cottages are now privately owned and not attached to the "Manor",which is about 120 years old and has now been divided into two residences. All the cottages have been modernised and are owned by people who work outside the village. In 1935 the cottages were sold for around Â£60, today prices are around Â£45,000. Four new houses have been built by farmers for their retirement. A Riding School is run from one of the cottages.
